item.title: ã€ŠMachine Learningã€‹Noteï¼šLinear Regression
item.description: Modal & Cost function Model Representation To describe the supervised learning problem slightly more formally, our goal is, given a trainingâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Modal & Cost function

Model Representation

To describe the supervised learning problem slightly more formally, our goal is, given a training set, to learn a function h : X â†’ Y so that h(x) is a â€œgoodâ€ predictor for the corresponding value of y.

For historical reasons, this function h is called a hypothesis. Seen pictorially, the process is therefore like this:

When the target variable that weâ€™re trying to predict is continuous, such as in our housing example, we call the learning problem a regression problem. When y can take on only a small number of discrete values (such as if, given the living area, we wanted to predict if a dwelling is a house or an apartment, say), we call it a classification problem.

Cost Function

We can measure the accuracy of our hypothesis function by using a cost function. This takes an average difference (actually a fancier version of an average) of all the results of the hypothesis with inputs from xâ€™s and the actual output yâ€™s.

J(Î¸0,Î¸1)=12mâˆ‘i=1m(y^iâˆ’yi)2=12mâˆ‘i=1m(hÎ¸(xi)âˆ’yi)2J\left(\theta_{0}, \theta_{1}\right)=\frac{1}{2 m} \sum_{i=1}^{m}\left(\hat{y}_{i}-y_{i}\right)^{2}=\frac{1}{2 m} \sum_{i=1}^{m}\left(h_{\theta}\left(x_{i}\right)-y_{i}\right)^{2}J(Î¸0â€‹,Î¸1â€‹)=2m1â€‹i=1âˆ‘mâ€‹(y^â€‹iâ€‹âˆ’yiâ€‹)2=2m1â€‹i=1âˆ‘mâ€‹(hÎ¸â€‹(xiâ€‹)âˆ’yiâ€‹)2

To break it apart, it is 12xâ€¾\frac{1}{2} \overline{x}21â€‹x where xâ€¾\overline{x}x is the mean of the squares of hÎ¸(xi)âˆ’yih_{\theta}\left(x_{i}\right)-y_{i}hÎ¸â€‹(xiâ€‹)âˆ’yiâ€‹â€‹, or the difference between the predicted value and the actual value.

This function is otherwise called the â€œSquared error functionâ€, or â€œMean squared errorâ€. The mean is halved (12)\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)(21â€‹) as a convenience for the computation of the gradient descent, as the derivative term of the square function will cancel out the(12)\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)(21â€‹) term. The following image summarizes what the cost function does:

A contour plot is a graph that contains many contour lines. A contour line of a two variable function has a constant value at all points of the same line. An example of such a graph is the one to the right below.

Taking any color and going along the â€˜circleâ€™, one would expect to get the same value of the cost function. For example, the three green points found on the green line above have the same value for J(Î¸0,Î¸1)J\left(\theta_{0}, \theta_{1}\right)J(Î¸0â€‹,Î¸1â€‹) and as a result, they are found along the same line. The circled x displays the value of the cost function for the graph on the left when Î¸0=800\theta_{0}=800Î¸0â€‹=800 and Î¸1=âˆ’0.15\theta_{1}=-0.15Î¸1â€‹=âˆ’0.15. Taking another h(x) and plotting its contour plot, one gets the following graphs:

When Î¸0=360\theta_{0}=360Î¸0â€‹=360 and Î¸1=0\theta_{1}=0Î¸1â€‹=0in the contour plot gets closer to the center thus reducing the cost function error. Now giving our hypothesis function a slightly positive slope results in a better fit of the data.

The graph above minimizes the cost function as much as possible and consequently, the result of Î¸1=1\theta_1=1Î¸1â€‹=1 and Î¸0=0\theta_0=0Î¸0â€‹=0 tend to be around 0.12 and 250 respectively. Plotting those values on our graph to the right seems to put our point in the center of the inner most â€˜circleâ€™.

Parameter Learning

So we have our hypothesis function and we have a way of measuring how well it fits into the data. Now we need to estimate the parameters in the hypothesis function. Thatâ€™s where gradient descent comes in.

Imagine that we graph our hypothesis function based on its fields Î¸0\theta_0Î¸0â€‹ and Î¸1\theta_1Î¸1â€‹ (actually we are graphing the cost function as a function of the parameter estimates). We are not graphing x and y itself, but the parameter range of our hypothesis function and the cost resulting from selecting a particular set of parameters.

We put Î¸0\theta_0Î¸0â€‹ on the x axis and Î¸1\theta_1Î¸1â€‹ on the y axis, with the cost function on the vertical z axis. The points on our graph will be the result of the cost function using our hypothesis with those specific theta parameters. The graph below depicts such a setup.

We will know that we have succeeded when our cost function is at the very bottom of the pits in our graph, i.e. when its value is the minimum. The red arrows show the minimum points in the graph.

The way we do this is by taking the derivative (the tangential line to a function) of our cost function. The slope of the tangent is the derivative at that point and it will give us a direction to move towards. We make steps down the cost function in the direction with the steepest descent. The size of each step is determined by the parameter Î±, which is called the learning rate.

For example, the distance between each â€˜starâ€™ in the graph above represents a step determined by our parameter Î±. A smaller Î± would result in a smaller step and a larger Î± results in a larger step. The direction in which the step is taken is determined by the partial derivative of J(Î¸0,Î¸1)J\left(\theta_{0}, \theta_{1}\right)J(Î¸0â€‹,Î¸1â€‹). Depending on where one starts on the graph, one could end up at different points. The image above shows us two different starting points that end up in two different places.

The gradient descent algorithm is:

Repeat until Convergence:

Î¸j:=Î¸jâˆ’Î±âˆ‚âˆ‚Î¸jJ(Î¸0,Î¸1)\theta_{j} :=\theta_{j}-\alpha \frac{\partial}{\partial \theta_{j}} J\left(\theta_{0}, \theta_{1}\right)Î¸jâ€‹:=Î¸jâ€‹âˆ’Î±âˆ‚Î¸jâ€‹âˆ‚â€‹J(Î¸0â€‹,Î¸1â€‹)

where

j=0,1 represents the feature index number.

At each iteration j, one should simultaneously update the parameters Î¸1,Î¸2,â€¦,Î¸n\theta_{1}, \theta_{2}, \ldots, \theta_{n}Î¸1â€‹,Î¸2â€‹,â€¦,Î¸nâ€‹. Updating a specific parameter prior to calculating another one on the j(th)j^{(t h)}j(th)iteration would yield to a wrong implementation.

Regardless of the slopeâ€™s sign for ddÎ¸1J(Î¸1),Î¸1\frac{d}{d \theta_{1}} J\left(\theta_{1}\right), \theta_{1}dÎ¸1â€‹dâ€‹J(Î¸1â€‹),Î¸1â€‹ eventually converges to its minimum value. The following graph shows that when the slope is negative, the value of Î¸1\theta_{1}Î¸1â€‹ increases and when it is positive, the value of Î¸1\theta_{1}Î¸1â€‹ decreases.

On a side note, we should adjust our parameter Î± to ensure that the gradient descent algorithm converges in a reasonable time. Failure to converge or too much time to obtain the minimum value imply that our step size is wrong.

How does gradient descent converge with a fixed step size Î±?

The intuition behind the convergence is that ddÎ¸1J(Î¸1)\frac{d}{d \theta_{1}} J\left(\theta_{1}\right)dÎ¸1â€‹dâ€‹J(Î¸1â€‹) approaches 0 as we approach the bottom of our convex function. At the minimum, the derivative will always be 0 and thus we get: â€‹

Î¸1:=Î¸1âˆ’Î±âˆ—0\theta_{1} :=\theta_{1}-\alpha * 0Î¸1â€‹:=Î¸1â€‹âˆ’Î±âˆ—0

item.title: ã€ŠMachine Learningã€‹Noteï¼šIntroduction
item.description: Chapter 1: Introduction Definition Arthur Samuel(1959): Field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitlyâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Chapter 1: Introduction

Definition

  • Arthur Samuel(1959): Field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed.
  • Tom Mitchell(1988): Well-posed Learning Problem: A computer program is said to learn from experience E with respect to some task T and some performance measure P, if its performance on T as measured by P improves with experience E.

ML Algorithms

Supervised Learning

In supervised learning, we are given a data set and already know what our correct output should look like, having the idea that there is a relationship between the input and the output.

Supervised learning problems are categorized into â€regressionâ€ and â€classificationâ€ problems. In a regression problem, we are trying to predict results within a continuous output, meaning that we are trying to map input variables to some continuous function. In a classification problem, we are instead trying to predict results in a discrete output. In other words, we are trying to map input variables into discrete categories.

Example:

  • Regression - Given a picture of a person, we have to predict their age on the basis of the given picture
  • Classification - Given a patient with a tumor, we have to predict whether the tumor is malignant or benign.

Unsupervised Learning

Unsupervised learning allows us to approach problems with little or no idea what our results should look like. We can derive structure from data where we donâ€™t necessarily know the effect of the variables.

We can derive this structure by clustering the data based on relationships among the variables in the data.

With unsupervised learning there is no feedback based on the prediction results.

Example:

  • Clustering: Take a collection of 1,000,000 different genes, and find a way to automatically group these genes into groups that are somehow similar or related by different variables, such as lifespan, location, roles, and so on.
  • Non-clustering: The â€œCocktail Party Algorithmâ€, allows you to find structure in a chaotic environment. (i.e. identifying individual voices and music from a mesh of sounds at a cocktail party).

/**

function *getNaturalNumber(){

var gen = getNaturalNumber();// å®ä¾‹åŒ–ä¸€ä¸ª Generator

InÂ computer programming, aÂ thunkÂ is aÂ subroutineÂ that is created, often automatically, to assist a call to another subroutine. Thunks are primarily used to represent an additional calculation that a subroutine needs to execute, or to call a routine that does not support the usual calling mechanism. They have a variety of other applications toÂ compiler code generationÂ and inÂ modular programming.

/**

function thunkify(fn) {
  return function(){
    var args = [].slice.call(arguments);
    var ctx = this;
    return function(done) {
      var called;

        if(called) return ;
        called = true;
        done.apply(null, arguments);

      try{
        fn.apply(ctx, args); // å°†ä»»åŠ¡å‡½æ•°ç½®åè¿è¡Œ
      } catch(ex) {
        done(ex);
      }
    }
  }
}

function run(generator) {
  var gen = generator();
  function next(data) {
    var ret = gen.next(data);
    if(ret.done) return Promise.resolve("done");
   	return Promise.resolve(ret.value)
    	.then(data => next(data))
    	.catch(ex => gen.throw(ex));
  }
  
  try{
    return next();
  } catch(ex) {
    return Promise.reject(ex);
  }
  
}

è¿™æ˜¯å…¸å‹çš„JavaScriptæµç¨‹æ§åˆ¶ï¼Œé—®é¢˜çš„å…³é”®æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•å®ç°ä»»åŠ¡çš„é¡ºåºæ‰§è¡Œã€‚åœ¨Expressæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªç±»ä¼¼çš„ä¸œè¥¿å«ä¸­é—´ä»¶ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªä¸­é—´ä»¶å’Œæˆ‘ä»¬è¿™é‡Œçš„åƒé¥­ã€ç¡è§‰ç­‰ä»»åŠ¡å¾ˆç±»ä¼¼ï¼Œæ¯ä¸€ä¸ªä¸­é—´ä»¶æ‰§è¡Œå®Œæˆåä¼šè°ƒç”¨next()å‡½æ•°ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªå‡½æ•°ç”¨æ¥è°ƒç”¨ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªä¸­é—´ä»¶ã€‚

å¯¹äºè¿™ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨ç›¸ä¼¼çš„æ€è·¯æ¥è§£å†³ï¼Œé¦–å…ˆåˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªä»»åŠ¡é˜Ÿåˆ—ï¼Œç„¶ååˆ©ç”¨next()å‡½æ•°æ¥æ§åˆ¶ä»»åŠ¡çš„é¡ºåºæ‰§è¡Œï¼š

function _LazyMan(name) {
    this.tasks = [];   
    var self = this;

    var fn =(function(n){
        var name = n;
        return function(){
            console.log("Hi! This is " + name + "!");
            self.next();
        }
    })(name);
    this.tasks.push(fn);
    setTimeout(function(){
        self.next();
    }, 0); // åœ¨ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªäº‹ä»¶å¾ªç¯å¯åŠ¨ä»»åŠ¡
}

/* äº‹ä»¶è°ƒåº¦å‡½æ•° */
_LazyMan.prototype.next = function() { 
    var fn = this.tasks.shift();
    fn && fn();
}

_LazyMan.prototype.eat = function(name) {
    var self = this;
    var fn =(function(name){
        return function(){
            console.log("Eat " + name + "~");
            self.next()
        }
    })(name);
    this.tasks.push(fn);
    return this; // å®ç°é“¾å¼è°ƒç”¨
}

_LazyMan.prototype.sleep = function(time) {
    var self = this;
    var fn = (function(time){
        return function() {
            setTimeout(function(){
                console.log("Wake up after " + time + "s!");
                self.next();
            }, time * 1000);
        }
    })(time);
    this.tasks.push(fn);
   return this;
}

_LazyMan.prototype.sleepFirst = function(time) {
    var self = this;
    var fn = (function(time) {
        return function() {
            setTimeout(function() {
                console.log("Wake up after " + time + "s!");
                self.next();
            }, time * 1000);
        }
    })(time);

    this.tasks.unshift(fn);
    return this;
}

/* å°è£… */
function LazyMan(name){
    return new _LazyMan(name);
}

item.title: Give It Five Minutes
item.description: ä»Šå¤©åœ¨çš„å®˜ç½‘ä¸Šçœ‹åˆ°äº† è¿™è¾¹æ–‡ç« ï¼Œçœ‹å®Œåæ„Ÿè§¦å¾ˆæ·±ï¼Œæ‘˜å½•å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼Œä¸å›å…±å‹‰ã€‚ A few years ago I used to be a hothead. Whenever anyone said anything, Iâ€™d think of a way to disagree. Iâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
ä»Šå¤©åœ¨Reactçš„å®˜ç½‘ä¸Šçœ‹åˆ°äº† è¿™è¾¹æ–‡ç« ï¼Œçœ‹å®Œåæ„Ÿè§¦å¾ˆæ·±ï¼Œæ‘˜å½•å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼Œä¸å›å…±å‹‰ã€‚

A few years ago I used to be a hothead. Whenever anyone said anything, Iâ€™d think of a way to disagree. Iâ€™d push back hard if something didnâ€™t fit my world-view.

Itâ€™s like I had to be first with an opinion â€“ as if being first meant something. But what it really meant was that I wasnâ€™t thinking hard enough about the problem. The faster you react, the less you think. Not always, but often.

Itâ€™s easy to talk about knee jerk reactions as if they are things that only other people have. You have them too. If your neighbor isnâ€™t immune, neither are you.

This came to a head back in 2007. I was speaking at the Business Innovation Factory conference in Providence, RI. So was Richard Saul Wurman. After my talk Richard came up to introduce himself and compliment my talk. That was very generous of him. He certainly didnâ€™t have to do that.

And what did I do? I pushed back at him about the talk he gave. While he was making his points on stage, I was taking an inventory of the things I didnâ€™t agree with. And when presented with an opportunity to speak with him, I quickly pushed back at some of his ideas. I must have seemed like such an asshole.

His response changed my life. It was a simple thing. He said â€œMan, give it five minutes.â€ I asked him what he meant by that? He said, itâ€™s fine to disagree, itâ€™s fine to push back, itâ€™s great to have strong opinions and beliefs, but give my ideas some time to set in before youâ€™re sure you want to argue against them. â€œFive minutesâ€ represented â€œthinkâ€, not react. He was totally right. I came into the discussion looking to prove something, not learn something.

This was a big moment for me.

Richard has spent his career thinking about these problems. Heâ€™s given it 30 years. And I gave it just a few minutes. Now, certainly he can be wrong and I could be right, but itâ€™s better to think deeply about something first before being so certain youâ€™re right.

Thereâ€™s also a difference between asking questions and pushing back. Pushing back means you already think you know. Asking questions means you want to know. Ask more questions.

Learning to think first rather than react quick is a life long pursuit. Itâ€™s tough. I still get hot sometimes when I shouldnâ€™t. But Iâ€™m really enjoying all the benefits of getting better. If you arenâ€™t sure why this is important, think about this quote from Jonathan Ive regarding Steve Jobsâ€™ reverence for ideas:

And just as Steve loved ideas, and loved making stuff, he treated the process of creativity with a rare and a wonderful reverence. You see, I think he better than anyone understood that while ideas ultimately can be so powerful, they begin as fragile, barely formed thoughts, so easily missed, so easily compromised, so easily just squished.

Thatâ€™s deep. Ideas are fragile. They often start powerless. Theyâ€™re barely there, so easy to ignore or skip or miss.

There are two things in this world that take no skill: 1. Spending other peopleâ€™s money and 2. Dismissing an idea.

Dismissing an idea is so easy because it doesnâ€™t involve any work. You can scoff at it. You can ignore it. You can puff some smoke at it. Thatâ€™s easy. The hard thing to do is protect it, think about it, let it marinate, explore it, riff on it, and try it. The right idea could start out life as the wrong idea.

So next time you hear something, or someone, talk about an idea, pitch an idea, or suggest an idea, give it five minutes. Think about it a little bit before pushing back, before saying itâ€™s too hard or itâ€™s too much work. Those things may be true, but there may be another truth in there too: It may be worth it.

item.content:encoded:
å¿«é€Ÿæ’åº

ç®—æ³•æè¿°

å¿«é€Ÿæ’åºæ˜¯åœ¨äº‹ä»¶ä¸­å·²çŸ¥çš„æœ€å¿«æ’åºç®—æ³•ï¼Œè¯¥ç®—æ³•ä¹‹æ‰€ä»¥è¿™ä¹ˆå¿«æ˜¯å› ä¸ºå…¶å†…éƒ¨é«˜åº¦ä¼˜åŒ–çš„å†…éƒ¨å¾ªç¯ã€‚å®ƒçš„æœ€åæƒ…å½¢è€—æ—¶O(N2)O(N^2)O(N2)ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ç¨åŠ ä¿®æ­£å°±å¯ä»¥é¿å…è¿™ç§æƒ…å½¢ã€‚å’Œå½’å¹¶æ’åºç±»ä¼¼ï¼Œå¿«é€Ÿæ’åºä¹Ÿæ˜¯ä¸€ç§åˆ†æ²»çš„é€’å½’æ’åºã€‚å¯¹äºå¾…æ’æ•°ç»„Sï¼Œå¿«é€Ÿæ’åºå¯ä»¥ç®€å•çš„æè¿°ä¸ºï¼š

  1. å¦‚æœSä¸­çš„å…ƒç´ ä¸ªæ•°ä¸º 0 æˆ– 1ï¼Œåˆ™è¿”å›ã€‚
  2. å–Sä¸­ä»»æ„ä¸€å…ƒç´ vï¼Œç§°ä¹‹ä¸ºæ¢çº½å…ƒï¼ˆpivotï¼‰ã€‚
  3. å°†Sâˆ’vS-\\{v\\}Sâˆ’v(S ä¸­çš„å…¶ä½™å…ƒç´ ï¼‰åˆ†æˆä¸¤ä¸ªä¸ç›¸äº¤çš„é›†åˆï¼šS1=xâˆˆSâˆ’vâˆ£xâ‰¤vS_1= \\{x \in S - \\{v\\} | x \leq v\\}S1â€‹=xâˆˆSâˆ’vâˆ£xâ‰¤v å’Œ S2=xâˆˆSâˆ’vâˆ£xâ‰¥vS_2= \\{x \in S - \\{v\\} | x \geq v\\}S2â€‹=xâˆˆSâˆ’vâˆ£xâ‰¥vã€‚
  4. è¿”å›quick_sort(S1)åï¼Œç»§éšvï¼Œç»§è€Œquick_sort(S2)ã€‚

ç”±äºå¯¹æ¢çº½å…ƒçš„å¤„ç†çš„ä¸åŒï¼Œç¬¬ä¸‰æ­¥åˆ†å‰²çš„æè¿°ä¸æ˜¯å”¯ä¸€çš„ï¼Œå› è€Œè¿™å°±æˆäº†è®¾è®¡ä¸Šçš„ä¸€ä¸ªå†³ç­–ã€‚

ç®—æ³•çš„æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦

ç®—æ³•å¹³å‡æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸ºï¼šO(NlogN)O(NlogN)O(NlogN)

C è¯­è¨€å®ç°

void swap(int* p, int* q) {
    int temp;
    temp = *q;
    *q = *p;
    *p = temp;
}

int media3(int *data, int left, int right){
    int center = (left + right) / 2;

    if(data[left] > data[center]) {
        swap(&data[left], &data[center]);
    }
    if(data[left] > data[right]) {
        swap(&data[left], &data[right]);
    }
    if(data[center] > data[right]) {
        swap(&data[center], &data[right]);
    } // å°† data[left], data[center], data[right] ä»å°åˆ°å¤§æ’å¥½åº

    swap(&data[center], &data[right - 1]); // å°† pivot æ”¾åˆ°å€’æ•°ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªä½ç½®

    return data[right - 1];

}

void quick_sort(int* data, int left, int right){
    int pivot, i = left, j = right - 1;
    if(left + CUTOFF <= right) { // å¦‚æœæ‰€å‰©å…ƒç´ å°äºä¸‰ä¸ªï¼Œ é‚£ä¹ˆè¿™ä¸èƒ½åˆ©ç”¨å¿«é€Ÿæ’åºäº†ï¼Œå› ä¸º Pivot çš„é€‰å–è‡³å°‘éœ€è¦ä¸‰ä¸ªå…ƒç´ 
        pivot = media3(data, left, right);
        while(1){
            while(data[++ i] < pivot) {}
            while(data[-- j] > pivot) {}
            if(i < j) {
                swap(&data[i], &data[j]);
            } else {
                break;
            }
        }
        swap(&data[i], &data[right - 1]);
        quick_sort(data, left, i - 1);
        quick_sort(data, i + 1, right);
    } else {
        insert_sort(data + left, right - left + 1 );// å¯¹äºå°é›¨ 3 ä¸ªçš„å…ƒç´ ï¼Œç›´æ¥åˆ©ç”¨æ’å…¥æ’åºæ¥è¿›è¡Œæ’åº
    }
}

int * insert_sort(int* data, int num){
	int i,j, temp;
	for(i = 0; i < num; i ++){
		temp = data[i];
		for(j = i; j > 0 && data[j - 1] > temp; j --){
			data[j] = data[j - 1];
		}
		data[j] = temp;
	}
	return data;
}

JavaScript å®ç°

function swap(data, pos1, pos2) {
  var temp = data[pos1];
  data[pos1] = data[pos2];
  data[pos2] = temp;
}

function media3(data, left, right) {
  var center = Math.floor((left + right) / 2);
  if (data[left] > data[center]) {
    swap(data, left, center);
  }
  if (data[left] > data[right]) {
    swap(data, left, right);
  }
  if (data[center] > data[right]) {
    swap(data, center, right);
  }
  swap(data, center, right - 1);
  return data[right - 1];
}

function quick_sort(data, left, right) {
  if (left + 3 <= right) {
    var center = Math.floor((left + right) / 2);
    var pivot = media3(data, left, right),
      i = left,
      j = right - 1;
    while (1) {
      while (data[++i] < pivot) {}
      while (data[--j] > pivot) {}
      if (i < j) {
        swap(data, i, j);
      } else {
        break;
      }
    }
    swap(data, center, right - 1);
    quick_sort(data, left, i - 1);
    quick_sort(data, i + 1, right);
  } else {
    insert_sort(data, left, right);
  }
}

function insert_sort(data, left, right) {
  if (left < right) {
    for (var i = 1; i < right - left + 1; i++) {
      var temp = data[i];
      for (var j = i; j > 0 && data[j - 1] > temp; j--) {
        data[j] = data[j - 1];
      }
      data[j] = temp;
    }
  }
  return data;
}

å½’å¹¶æ’åº

ç®—æ³•æè¿°

ç°åœ¨æˆ‘ä»¬æ¥ä»‹ç»ä¸€ç§å¾ˆå·§å¦™çš„æ’åºç®—æ³•â€”â€”å½’å¹¶æ’åºã€‚ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¯´å®ƒå·§å¦™å‘¢ï¼Œå½’å¹¶æ’åºåˆ©ç”¨é€’å½’æ¥å®ç°åˆ†æ²»ï¼Œä»è€Œæå¤§çš„ç®€åŒ–äº†ä»£ç é‡ï¼Œæ’åºç®—æ³•æ¸…æ™°æ˜äº†ï¼Œè€Œä¸”é€Ÿåº¦ä¹Ÿæ˜¯ç›¸å½“çš„å¿«ã€‚å½’å¹¶æ’åºçš„åŸºæœ¬æ“ä½œæ˜¯åˆå¹¶ä¸¤ä¸ªå·²æ’åºçš„è¡¨ï¼Œå› ä¸ºè¿™ä¸¤ä¸ªè¡¨æ˜¯å·²æ’åºçš„ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥è‹¥å°†è¾“å‡ºæ”¾åˆ°ç¬¬ä¸‰ä¸ªè¡¨ä¸­ï¼Œè¯¥ç®—æ³•å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡å¯¹è¾“å‡ºæ•°æ®ä¸€è¶Ÿæ’åºæ¥å®Œæˆã€‚

ç®—æ³•çš„æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦

å½’å¹¶çš„æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦æ˜¯å‰ä¸‰ç§æ’åºç®—æ³•é‡Œé¢æœ€å¥½çš„ï¼Œä¸ºO(NlogN)O(NlogN)O(NlogN)

C è¯­è¨€å®ç°

void merge_sort(int * data, int num){
    int * dataTemp = (int*) malloc(sizeof(int) * num);
    if(dataTemp != NULL) {
        m_sort(data, dataTemp, 0, num - 1);
    } else {
        printf("No Space For dataTemp!");
    }
}

void m_sort(int * data, int * dataTemp, int left, int right) {
    int center;
    if(left < right) {
        center = (left + right) / 2;
        m_sort(data, dataTemp, left, center);
        m_sort(data, dataTemp, center + 1, right);
        merge(data, dataTemp, left, center + 1, right);
    }
}

void merge(int * data, int*dataTemp, int leftPos, int rightPos, int rightEnd){
    int leftEnd = rightPos - 1,
        tempPos = leftPos,
        i,
        total = (rightEnd - leftPos + 1);

    while(leftPos <= leftEnd && rightPos <= rightEnd) {
        if(data[leftPos] < data[rightPos]) {
            dataTemp[tempPos ++] = data[leftPos ++];
        } else {
            dataTemp[tempPos ++] = data[rightPos ++];
        }
    }

    while(leftPos <= leftEnd) {
        dataTemp[tempPos ++] = data[leftPos ++];
    }

    while(rightPos <= rightEnd) {
         dataTemp[tempPos ++] = data[rightPos ++];
    }

    for(i = 0; i < total; i ++, rightEnd --) {
        data[rightEnd] = dataTemp[rightEnd];
    }
}

JavaScript å®ç°

function merge_sort(data) {
  var dataTemp = new Array(data.length);
  m_sort(data, dataTemp, 0, data.length - 1);
}

function m_sort(data, dataTemp, left, right) {
  if (left < right) {
    var center = Math.floor((left + right) / 2);
    m_sort(data, dataTemp, left, center);
    m_sort(data, dataTemp, center + 1, right);
    merge(data, dataTemp, left, center + 1, right);
  }
}

function merge(data, dataTemp, leftPos, rightPos, rightEnd) {
  var leftEnd = rightPos - 1,
    tempPos = leftPos,
    total = rightEnd - leftPos + 1;

  while (leftPos <= leftEnd && rightPos <= rightEnd) {
    if (data[leftPos] < data[rightPos]) {
      dataTemp[tempPos++] = data[leftPos++];
    } else {
      dataTemp[tempPos++] = data[rightPos++];
    }
  }

  while (leftPos <= leftEnd) {
    dataTemp[tempPos++] = data[leftPos++];
  }

  while (rightPos <= rightEnd) {
    dataTemp[tempPos++] = data[rightPos++];
  }

  for (var i = 0; i < total; i++, rightEnd--) {
    data[rightEnd] = dataTemp[rightEnd];
  }
}

å¸Œå°”æ’åºä¹Ÿæˆä¸ºå¢é‡æ’åºã€‚å¸Œå°”æ’åºä½¿ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªåºåˆ—h1,h2,h3,â€¦ht\\{h_1, h_2, h_3, â€¦ h_t\\}h1â€‹,h2â€‹,h3â€‹,â€¦htâ€‹ï¼Œå«å¢é‡åºåˆ—ã€‚åªè¦h1=1h_1 = 1h1â€‹=1ï¼Œä»»ä½•å¢é‡åºåˆ—éƒ½æ˜¯å¯ä»¥çš„ã€‚åœ¨ä½¿ç”¨å¢é‡hkh_khkâ€‹çš„ä¸€è¶Ÿæ’åºåï¼Œå¯¹äºæ¯ä¸€ä¸ªiiiæˆ‘ä»¬æœ‰A[i]â‰¤A[i+hk]A[i] \leq A[i + h_k]A[i]â‰¤A[i+hkâ€‹]ï¼ˆA ä¸ºå¾…æ’åºçš„æ•°ç»„ï¼‰ï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰ç›¸éš”hkh_khkâ€‹çš„å…ƒç´ éƒ½å°†è¢«æ’åºï¼Œæ­¤æ—¶ç§°å…¶ä¸ºhk-æ’åºçš„ã€‚å¸Œå°”æ’åºçš„ä¸€ä¸ªé‡è¦æ€§è´¨æ˜¯ï¼šä¸€ä¸ªhkh_khkâ€‹æ’åºçš„æ–‡ä»¶å°†ä¿æŒå®ƒçš„h_k æ’åºæ€§ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯è¯´ç»hkâˆ’1h_{k-1}hkâˆ’1â€‹æ’åºåï¼Œä»»ç„¶æ»¡è¶³A[i]â‰¤A[i+hk]A[i] \leq A[i + h_k]A[i]â‰¤A[i+hkâ€‹]ã€‚

ç®—æ³•æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦

ä¾æ®æ‰€é€‰æ‹©çš„å¢é‡åºåˆ—çš„ä¸åŒï¼Œç®—æ³•çš„æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¹Ÿæœ‰æ‰€ä¸åŒã€‚å¯¹äº shell æœ¬äººæ¨èçš„ht=N/2ï¼Œhk=hk+1/2ht = N / 2ï¼Œ hk = h_{k+1} / 2ht=N/2ï¼Œhk=hk+1â€‹/2å¢é‡åºåˆ—æ¥è¯´ï¼Œæ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸ºï¼šO(N32)O(N ^ {\frac{3}{2}})O(N23â€‹)ã€‚

C è¯­è¨€å®ç°

int * shell_sort(int * data, int num){
	int i, j, increment, temp;
	for(increment = num / 2; increment > 0 ; increment = increment / 2){
		for(i = increment; i < num; i ++){
			temp = data[i];
			for(j = i; j >= increment; j -= increment){
				if(temp < data[j - increment])
					data[j] = data[j - increment];
				else
					break;
			}

			data[j] = temp;
		}  
	}
	return data;
}

JavaScript å®ç°

function shell_sort(data) {
    var increment = Math.floor((data.length / 2));
    var temp;
    for (; increment > 0; increment =  Math.floor((increment / 2))) {
        for (var i = increment; i < data.length; i ++) {
            temp = data[i];
            for(var j = i; j >= increment; j -= increment) {
                if(temp < data[j - increment]) {
                    data[j] = data[j - increment];
                } else {
                    break;
                }
            }
            data[j] = temp;
        }
    }
}

å‰è¨€

æ’åºï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªçœ‹ä¼¼ç®€å•çš„é—®é¢˜å…¶å®å­˜åœ¨ç€å¾ˆæ·±çš„å­¦é—®ã€‚éƒ½è¯´å¤©ä¸‹æ­¦åŠŸï¼Œæ— å¿«ä¸ç ´ï¼Œå…¶å®æ’åºä¹Ÿæ˜¯ã€‚æ’åºçš„é€Ÿåº¦åŸºæœ¬ä¸Šå†³å®šäº†ä¸€ä¸ªæ’åºç®—æ³•çš„å¥½åï¼ˆæš‚ä¸è€ƒè™‘ç©ºé—´å¤æ‚åº¦ï¼‰ã€‚å¸¸è§çš„æ’åºç®—æ³•æœ‰æ’å…¥æ’åºï¼Œå¸Œå°”æ’åºï¼Œå½’å¹¶æ’åºå’Œå¿«é€Ÿæ’åºã€‚ç°åœ¨æˆ‘ä»¬åˆ†åˆ«ç”¨C è¯­è¨€å’ŒJavaScriptåˆ†åˆ«å®ç°ï¼Œå¹¶æ¯”è¾ƒè¿™å››ç§æ’åºç®—æ³•çš„ä¼˜åŠ£ã€‚æ­¤å¤–ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬è¿˜æ¯”è¾ƒäº†ä¸åŒè¯­è¨€ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼ˆC è¯­è¨€å’ŒJavaScriptï¼‰çš„åŒä¸€ç§æ’åºç®—æ³•æ’åºå¿«æ…¢ã€‚

æ’å…¥æ’åº

æ’å…¥æ’åºè¿™ 4 ä¸­æ’åºé‡Œé¢æœ€æ…¢çš„ï¼Œä½†åŒæ—¶ä¹Ÿæ˜¯æœ€ç®€å•çš„æ’åºç®—æ³•ã€‚å®ƒç†è§£èµ·æ¥å…¶å®å¾ˆç®€å•ï¼Œå¯¹äº N ä¸ªå…ƒç´ çš„æ’åºï¼Œæ’å…¥æ’åºç”±N - 1è¶Ÿç»„æˆã€‚å¯¹äºè¿™ P = 1 åˆ° P= N - 1 è¶Ÿä¸­çš„æ¯ä¸€è¶Ÿ P è€Œè¨€ï¼Œæ’å…¥æ’åºä¿è¯ä»ä½ç½® 0 åˆ°ä½ç½® P ä¸Šçš„å…ƒç´ å‡ä¸ºå·²æ’åºçŠ¶æ€ã€‚åœ¨ç¬¬ P è¶Ÿçš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œç®—æ³•å°†ä½ç½® P ä¸Šçš„å…ƒç´ å‘å·¦ç§»åŠ¨åˆ°å®ƒåœ¨å‰ P+1 ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ä¸­çš„æ­£ç¡®ä½ç½®ã€‚

å› ä¸ºç®—æ³•éœ€è¦è¿›è¡Œçš„å¾ªç¯æ¬¡æ•°ä¸º1+2+3+...+N=(N+1)âˆ—N/21 + 2 + 3 + ... + N = (N + 1) * N / 21+2+3+...+N=(N+1)âˆ—N/2ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç®—æ³•çš„æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸ºO(N2)O(N^2)O(N2)ã€‚

int * insert_sort(int* data, int num){

		}

	}

    }

æ€§èƒ½æ¨ªå‘æ¯”è¾ƒ

  • æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿï¼šWindows 8 ä¼ä¸šç‰ˆ 64 ä½
  • è½¯ä»¶å¹³å°ï¼šVisual Studio 10 å’Œ Nodejs v4.2.1
  • æµ‹è¯•æ•°æ®ï¼š100000 æ¡éšæœºç”Ÿæˆçš„æ•°æ®

C è¯­è¨€ç‰ˆæœ¬çš„æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç 

/**
*C è¯­è¨€ç‰ˆæœ¬çš„æ’å…¥æ’åºæµ‹è¯•
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <time.h>
int * insert_sort(int* data, int num);
int main(){
    FILE * file;
    int data_size = 100000;// æµ‹è¯•æ•°æ®çš„å¤§å°
    int *data = (int*) malloc(sizeof(int) * data_size),temp, i;
    time_t start, end;
    file = fopen("src.txt", "r");
    if(file) {
        for(i = 0; i < data_size && !feof(file); i ++) {
            fscanf(file, "%d", &temp);
            data[i] = temp;
        }// è¯»å–æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­çš„æ•°æ®åˆ°å†…å­˜
        start = clock();
        insert_sort(data, data_size);
        end = clock();
        printf("C è¯­è¨€ç‰ˆ insert_sort: %dms", end - start);
    } else {
        printf("open file src.txt error!");
    }
    getchar();
    return 0;
}

int * insert_sort(int* data, int num){
	int i,j, temp;
	for(i = 0; i < num; i ++){
		temp = data[i];
		for(j = i; j > 0 && data[j - 1] > temp; j --){
			data[j] = data[j - 1];
		}
		data[j] = temp;
	}
	return data;
}

JavaSript ç‰ˆæœ¬çš„æµ‹è¯•ä»£ç 

var fs = require("fs");
var result;
function insert_sort(data){
    var temp;
    for(var i = 0 ; i < data.length; i ++) {
        temp = data[i];
        for(var j = i; j > 0; j --) {
            if(temp < data[j]) {
                data[j - 1] = data[j]
            }
        }
        data[j] = temp; //å°†ç¬¬ i è¶Ÿçš„ç¬¬ i ä¸ªå…ƒç´ æ”¾åˆ°å‰ i+1 ä¸ªå…ƒç´ çš„åˆé€‚ä½ç½®
    }
}

fs.readFile("src.txt", function(err, result){
   data =  result.toString("ascii").split("\n").map(function(value){
        return parseInt(value)
    });
    console.time("javascript ç‰ˆæœ¬ insert_sort");
    insert_sort(data);
    console.timeEnd("javascript ç‰ˆæœ¬ insert_sort")
})

function use(ids, callback) {
     if (!Array.isArray(ids)) ids = [ids];
     Promise.all(ids.map(function (id) {
         return load(myLoader.config.root + id);
     })).then(function (list) {
         callback.apply(global, list);// åŠ è½½å®Œæˆï¼Œ è°ƒç”¨å›è°ƒå‡½æ•°
     }, function (error) {

åœ¨è½¬æ¢å‰ï¼Œå…ˆå®šä¹‰ä¸€å¼ ç´¢å¼•è¡¨ï¼Œè¿™å¼ è¡¨è§„å®šäº†å¦‚ä½•è½¬æ¢ã€‚ è½¬æ¢çš„æ—¶å€™æˆ‘ä»¬å…ˆå°†äºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—åˆ†ç»„ï¼Œæ¯ 6 ä¸ªæ¯”ç‰¹ä¸ºä¸€ç»„ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯å¦‚æœç¼–ç çš„å­—èŠ‚æ•°ä¸èƒ½è¢« 3 æ•´é™¤ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆæœ€åå°±ä¼šå¤šå‡º 1 ä¸ªæˆ–ä¸¤ä¸ªå­—èŠ‚ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ä¸‹é¢çš„æ–¹æ³•è¿›è¡Œå¤„ç†ï¼šå…ˆä½¿ç”¨ 0 å­—èŠ‚å€¼åœ¨æœ«å°¾è¡¥è¶³ï¼Œä½¿å…¶èƒ½å¤Ÿè¢« 3 æ•´é™¤ï¼Œç„¶åå†è¿›è¡Œ base64 çš„ç¼–ç ã€‚åœ¨ç¼–ç åçš„ base64 æ–‡æœ¬ååŠ ä¸Šä¸€ä¸ªæˆ–ä¸¤ä¸ªâ€™=â€˜å·ï¼Œä»£è¡¨è¡¥è¶³çš„å­—èŠ‚æ•°ã€‚ä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯è¯´ï¼Œå½“æœ€åå‰©ä½™ä¸€ä¸ªå…«ä½å­—èŠ‚ï¼ˆä¸€ä¸ª byteï¼‰æ—¶ï¼Œæœ€åä¸€ä¸ª 6 ä½çš„ base64 å­—èŠ‚å—æœ‰å››ä½æ˜¯ 0 å€¼ï¼Œæœ€åé™„åŠ ä¸Šä¸¤ä¸ªç­‰å·ï¼›å¦‚æœæœ€åå‰©ä½™ä¸¤ä¸ªå…«ä½å­—èŠ‚ï¼ˆ2 ä¸ª byteï¼‰æ—¶ï¼Œæœ€åä¸€ä¸ª 6 ä½çš„ base å­—èŠ‚å—æœ‰ä¸¤ä½æ˜¯ 0 å€¼ï¼Œæœ€åé™„åŠ ä¸€ä¸ªç­‰å·ã€‚ å‚è€ƒä¸‹è¡¨ï¼š

ç”¨ JavaScript å®ç° Base64

åŸç†æ˜ç™½äº†ä»¥åï¼Œå®ç°èµ·æ¥å°±å¾ˆå®¹æ˜“äº†ã€‚

define(function(require, exports, module) {

    var code = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/".split(""); //ç´¢å¼•è¡¨

    /**
     * @author natumsol@gmail.com
     * @description å°†äºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—è½¬æ¢ä¸º Base64 ç¼–ç 
     * @param  {String}
     * @return {String}
     */
    function binToBase64(bitString) {
        var result = "";
        var tail = bitString.length % 6;
        var bitStringTemp1 = bitString.substr(0, bitString.length - tail);
        var bitStringTemp2 = bitString.substr(bitString.length - tail, tail);
        for (var i = 0; i < bitStringTemp1.length; i += 6) {
            var index = parseInt(bitStringTemp1.substr(i, 6), 2);
            result += code[index];
        }
        bitStringTemp2 += new Array(7 - tail).join("0");
        if (tail) {
            result += code[parseInt(bitStringTemp2, 2)];
            result += new Array((6 - tail) / 2 + 1).join("=");
        }
        return result;
    }

    /**
     * @author natumsol@gmail.com
     * @description å°† base64 ç¼–ç è½¬æ¢ä¸ºäºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—
     * @param  {String}
     * @return {String}
     */
    function base64ToBin(str) {
        var bitString = "";
        var tail = 0;
        for (var i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {
            if (str[i] != "=") {
                var decode = code.indexOf(str[i]).toString(2);
                bitString += (new Array(7 - decode.length)).join("0") + decode;
            } else {
                tail++;
            }
        }
        return bitString.substr(0, bitString.length - tail * 2);
    }

    /**
     * @description å°†å­—ç¬¦è½¬æ¢ä¸ºäºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—
     * @param  {String} str
     * @return {String}    
     */
    function stringToBin(str) {
        var result = "";
        for (var i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {
            var charCode = str.charCodeAt(i).toString(2);
            result += (new Array(9 - charCode.length).join("0") + charCode);
        }
        return result;
    }
    /**
     * @description å°†äºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—è½¬æ¢ä¸ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²
     * @param {String} Bin
     */
    function BinToStr(Bin) {
        var result = "";
        for (var i = 0; i < Bin.length; i += 8) {
            result += String.fromCharCode(parseInt(Bin.substr(i, 8), 2));
        }
        return result;
    }
    exports.base64 = function(str) {
        return binToBase64(stringToBin(str));
    }
    exports.decodeBase64 = function(str) {
        return BinToStr(base64ToBin(str));
    }
})

function getCanvas(w, h) {
		var c = document.createElement('canvas');

		c.height = h;

function getPixels(img) {
	var c = getCanvas(img.width, img.height);
	var ctx = c.getContext('2d');
	ctx.drawImage(img, 0, 0);
	return ctx.getImageData(0, 0, c.width, c.height);
}

  3. å°†å›¾ç‰‡åƒç´ ä¿¡æ¯çš„äºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—å’Œå›¾ç‰‡å®½é«˜åº¦çš„äºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—ç»„åˆèµ·æ¥ï¼Œç„¶åå†è¿›è¡Œ Base64 çš„ç¼–ç

function img2Base64(img) {
	var imgData = getPixels(img).data;
	var imgWidth = getPixels(img).width;
	var imgHeight = getPixels(img).height;
	var bin = "";
	for (var i = 0; i < imgData.length; i++) {
		bin += base.numToString(imgData[i]);
	}
	bin = bin + base.stringToBin("$$" + imgWidth + "," + imgHeight + "$$");
	return base.binToBase64(bin);
}

å°†å›¾ç‰‡ Base64 æ•°æ®è¿›è¡Œè§£ç 

è§£ç æ˜¯ç¼–ç çš„é€†è¿‡ç¨‹ã€‚è¿‡ç¨‹å¤§è‡´ä¸ºï¼š

  1. å°†å›¾ç‰‡çš„ Base64 ä¿¡æ¯è¿›è¡Œè§£ç ï¼Œå¾—åˆ°åŒ…å«å›¾ç‰‡åƒç´ ä¿¡æ¯å’Œå®½é«˜åº¦ä¿¡æ¯çš„äºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—ï¼›
  2. ç„¶åå°†è¿™ä¸ªäºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—è§£ç æˆå­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼Œè·å–é«˜åº¦å’Œå®½åº¦ä¿¡æ¯ï¼›
  3. å»é™¤äºŒè¿›åˆ¶åºåˆ—ä¸­çš„é«˜åº¦å’Œå®½åº¦ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œå¾—åˆ°åƒç´ ä¿¡æ¯ï¼›
  4. æ ¹æ®åƒç´ ä¿¡æ¯ç”Ÿæˆåƒç´ çŸ©é˜µï¼›
  5. æ ¹æ®åƒç´ çŸ©é˜µã€å®½åº¦å’Œé«˜åº¦åˆ›å»ºå›¾ç‰‡å¯¹è±¡ImageDataï¼›
  6. åˆ©ç”¨putImageDataå°†å›¾åƒç»˜åˆ¶å‡ºæ¥ã€‚

å…·ä½“çš„ä»£ç å®ç°ä¸ºï¼š

function paint(imgData) {
		var canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
		var ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");
		ctx.fillRect(0, 0, imgData.width, imgData.height);
		ctx.putImageData(imgData, 0, 0);
	}

function base642img(data) {
	var str = base.BinToStr(base.base64ToBin(data));
	var imgWidth = str.match(/\$\$(\d+),(\d+)\$\$$/, "")[1];
	var imgHeight = str.match(/\$\$(\d+),(\d+)\$\$$/, "")[2]
	var imgData = base.base64ToBin(data).replace(base.stringToBin("$$" + imgWidth + "," + imgHeight + "$$"), "");

	var ImageDataArray = new Uint8ClampedArray(imgWidth * imgHeight * 4);
	for (var i = 0; i < ImageDataArray.length; i++) {
		ImageDataArray[i] = parseInt(imgData.substr(i * 8, 8), 2);
	}
	return new ImageData(ImageDataArray, imgWidth, imgHeight);
